name: flickr.photos.getExif
description: Retrieves a list of EXIF/TIFF/GPS tags for a given photo. The calling user must have permission to view the photo.
authentication: This method does not require authentication.

arguments.name: api_key
arguments.description: Your API application key.See herefor more details.

arguments.name: photo_id
arguments.description: The id of the photo to fetch information for.

arguments.name: secret
arguments.description: The secret for the photo. If the correct secret is passed then permissions checking is skipped. This enables the 'sharing' of individual photos by passing around the id and secret.

response:
<photo id="4424" secret="06b8e43bc7" server="2">
  <exif tagspace="TIFF" tagspaceid="1" tag="271" label="Manufacturer">
    <raw>Canon</raw>
  </exif>
  <exif tagspace="EXIF" tagspaceid="0" tag="33437" label="Aperture">
    <raw>90/10</raw>
    <clean>f/9</clean>
  </exif>
  <exif tagspace="GPS" tagspaceid="3" tag="4" label="Longitude">
    <raw>64/1, 42/1, 4414/100</raw>
    <clean>64Â° 42' 44.14"</clean>
  </exif>
</photo>

errors.title: Photo not foundThe photo id was either invalid or was for a photo not viewable by the calling user.
Permission deniedThe owner of the photo does not want to share EXIF data.
Invalid API KeyThe API key passed was not valid or has expired.
Service currently unavailableThe requested service is temporarily unavailable.
Write operation failedThe requested operation failed due to a temporary issue.
Format "xxx" not foundThe requested response format was not found.
Method "xxx" not foundThe requested method was not found.
Invalid SOAP envelopeThe SOAP envelope send in the request could not be parsed.
Invalid XML-RPC Method CallThe XML-RPC request document could not be parsed.
Bad URL foundOne or more arguments contained a URL that has been used for abuse on Flickr.
